data.text: These are the ◄proverbs/wise sayings► that come from Solomon, the King of Israel, who was the son of King David.
◄These proverbs [PRS] can teach people/By studying these proverbs, people can learn► how to be wise
These proverbs [PRS] will teach you how to discipline/control yourselves,
They will show people who do not yet know much how to do things that are smart.
Those who are wise should also pay attention to these proverbs,
Then they will be able to understand the meaning of proverbs and parables/metaphors,
If you want to be wise, you must begin by revering Yahweh.
My son, pay attention to what I, your father, am teaching you.
What we teach you will make you respected like having a lovely turban around your head
My son, if sinners tempt/entice you to do what is wrong,
They may say, “Come with us! Join us!
We will kill them [HYP] and get rid of them completely,
And we will seize all the things that they own.
So, come with us!
My son, do not accompany them!
They rush to do evil deeds!
It is useless to put out a ◄trap/net to catch a bird► because when a bird sees it,
But those wicked people are not like the birds,
That is what happens to people who eagerly try to get things by violently attacking others.
Wisdom [PRS] shouts to people in the streets,
Wisdom calls out in noisy places,
Wisdom says, “How long will you stupid people continue to enjoy doing foolish things [RHQ]?
If you pay attention to me when I rebuke you,
But when I called to you, you refused to listen.
I tried to advise you,
So now, when you are experiencing troubles/disasters,
When calamities strike you like a big storm,
Wisdom also says, “hen foolish people call to me to help them,
They refused to know what things are right,
They would not accept my advice,
So they will endure what will result [MET, DOU] from the evil way they have lived/behaved
Those who turn away from me are stupid/foolish;
But those who pay attention to me will live peacefully and safely,
